unnormalised: Forget rote learning, folks! Adaptive learning is making waves across India, and it’s tastier than your grandma's garam masala. Think personalized learning paths, like tailoring your thali to your spice tolerance.

unnormalised: Leading ed-tech startups, from Byju's to Vedantu, are heavily investing in AI-powered platforms that adjust to each student's pace and understanding. Remember those dreaded standardized tests? Adaptive learning aims to make those dinosaurs extinct.

unnormalised: Dr. Sharma from IIT Delhi calls it a “game-changer,” allowing educators to identify knowledge gaps and provide targeted support. Even schools in small towns like Kanpur are jumping on the bandwagon.

unnormalised: Imagine, no more forcing everyone to run at the same speed! Students in rural areas can learn at their own pace, accessing quality education regardless of location. Plus, the cost of customized learning platforms is decreasing, making it accessible even to families on a budget of Rs. 5000/month for education.
